definition: straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: To get where we have always dreamed of going, we must rise to the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 为实现梦想，我们必须挺身面对挑战。

sentences.english: The only people who have sought physically to stop this dumping are Somali pirates.
sentences.chinese: 唯一挺身而出阻止这种倾倒行为的人是索马里海盗。

sentences.english: Zhang Xun , instead of following suit , fought bravely with the rebel army.
sentences.chinese: 张巡却挺身而出，勇敢地抗击叛军。

sentences.english: But he that stands by it now, deserves the love and thanks of every man and woman.
sentences.chinese: 但真正挺身以卫国者，值得天下男女的爱及感谢。

sentences.english: Had Dong Cunri not belt the cat, our troop would have suffered much more.
sentences.chinese: 如果董存瑞没有挺身而出，我们的队伍将损失更大。

sentences.english: When it comes to the chest, you can't go wrong with the push-ups.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要练胸肌，多作些伏地挺身就绝不会错了。

sentences.english: They finally rise up and burst their fetters.
sentences.chinese: 他们最后挺身而起，挣开枷锁。

sentences.english: He was the first to take up the cudgels for his friend.
sentences.chinese: 他是第一个挺身为他朋友讲话的人。

sentences.english: Stepped forward determinedly, Mr. Johnson looked at the long road ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生望着面前漫长的道路毅然挺身而出。

sentences.english: When we said that Mary was getting fat, she drew herself up angrily and walked out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 当我说玛丽发胖了时，她气得挺身走出了屋子。

sentences.english: Wendi come forward to protect her husband's behavior has been the scene of the British Members appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 邓文迪挺身护夫的行为得到了现场英国议员的赞赏。

sentences.english: I ask the Minister of Ethnic Affairs Pansy Wong to stand up for the ethnic communities.
sentences.chinese: 请少数民族事务部黄部长为少数族裔利益挺身而出。

sentences.english: I can do 100 push-ups in a row.
sentences.chinese: 我可以一次做100个伏地挺身。

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet after rolling on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上打了个滚，挺身跳了起来。

sentences.english: Mr. Johnson looked at the long road ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊先生望着面前漫长的道路毅然挺身而出。

definition: dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to straighten one's back/to arch one's back
to strive/to make an effort/to exert oneself
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to stop/to halt/halt!/to hold resolutely (of a view, an aspiration etc)
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
